docs.abstract: The social network says it has struggled to get the information to researchers because it also wants to protect its users’ privacy.
docs.snippet: The social network says it has struggled to get the information to researchers because it also wants to protect its users’ privacy.
docs.lead_paragraph: In April 2018, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, told Congress about an ambitious plan to share huge amounts of posts, links and other user data with researchers around the world so that they could study and flag disinformation on the site.

headline.main: Ahead of 2020, Facebook Falls Short on Plan to Share Data on Disinformation
headline.print_headline: Facebook Fails to Part With Data

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: To create his first Netflix series, which starts streaming on Friday, Mr. Murphy ripped up his playbook and tried some new narrative tricks to encourage binge-watching.
docs.snippet: To create his first Netflix series, which starts streaming on Friday, Mr. Murphy ripped up his playbook and tried some new narrative tricks to encourage binge-watching.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Ryan Murphy, the prolific television producer behind “American Horror Story,” “American Crime Story” and “Pose,” had a plan for the moment his first Netflix series would become available.

headline.main: Ryan Murphy, Super Producer, Reboots Himself for Netflix and ‘The Politician’
headline.print_headline: Ripping Up the Playbook to Produce a Binge-Worthy Netflix Show

docs.abstract: Numerous mass shootings have activists putting more money into starker marketing campaigns, the latest of which will debut on Wednesday morning.
docs.snippet: Numerous mass shootings have activists putting more money into starker marketing campaigns, the latest of which will debut on Wednesday morning.
docs.lead_paragraph: Going back to school means worrying about what to wear, deciding what classes to take and, increasingly, knowing what to do if someone appears on campus with a gun.

headline.main: With Harrowing Ads, Gun Safety Groups Push a Scarier Reality
headline.print_headline: Back-to-School Gear Sends Stark Message In Ad for Gun Safety

docs.abstract: Beijing hopes its social credit system will quickly punish companies accused of wrongdoing. U.S. firms could get hit, too.
docs.snippet: Beijing hopes its social credit system will quickly punish companies accused of wrongdoing. U.S. firms could get hit, too.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China is funneling vast amounts of public and private data into huge databases aimed at tightening its control over its nearly 1.4 billion people.

headline.main: China Scores Businesses, and Low Grades Could Be a Trade-War Weapon
headline.print_headline: In China, Big Brother Targets Business

byline.original: By Alexandra Stevenson and Paul Mozur

docs.abstract: Former researchers for a “food computer” initiative at the lab say the project’s leader misled outsiders about how it was going.
docs.snippet: Former researchers for a “food computer” initiative at the lab say the project’s leader misled outsiders about how it was going.
docs.lead_paragraph: The M.I.T. Media Lab, an unconventional research center at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, has been under scrutiny since August, when its financial ties to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein became public. Now researchers who worked at the lab say that one of its high-profile scientific projects was promoted with misleading claims.

headline.main: M.I.T. Media Lab, Already Rattled by the Epstein Scandal, Has a New Worry
headline.print_headline: Media Lab Is Facing New Worry

docs.abstract: The move underscores the limitations of the Fed’s new approach to setting interest rates.
docs.snippet: The move underscores the limitations of the Fed’s new approach to setting interest rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve stepped into financial markets on Tuesday to keep short-term interest rates from rising — the first time the central bank has had to carry out this type of “market operation” since the global financial crisis.

headline.main: Fed Jumps Into Market to Push Down Rates, a First Since the Financial Crisis
headline.print_headline: Fed Jumps Into Markets to Push Down Rates, a First Since 2008

byline.original: By Matt Phillips and Jeanna Smialek

docs.abstract: Since 2010, Buick dealers’ lots have been filled with a mélange of G.M.-owned vehicles borrowed from Opel, Holden, Daewoo and others, with a Buick badge affixed.
docs.snippet: Since 2010, Buick dealers’ lots have been filled with a mélange of G.M.-owned vehicles borrowed from Opel, Holden, Daewoo and others, with a Buick badge affixed.
docs.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Buick, the rock upon which General Motors was built more than a century ago, appears to be fading in the company’s rearview mirror.

headline.main: Buick Name Is Erased From Buicks as Sales Slip for Century-Old Marque
headline.print_headline: Would G.M. Really Rather Not Have a Buick?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Buick Division of General Motors Corp

docs.abstract: The settlement is the latest fallout from Mr. Ghosn’s arrest in Japan on suspicion of attempting to hide part of his compensation from investors.
docs.snippet: The settlement is the latest fallout from Mr. Ghosn’s arrest in Japan on suspicion of attempting to hide part of his compensation from investors.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The Securities and Exchange Commission announced Monday that it had reached a deal with Nissan to settle allegations that Nissan concealed from investors a plan to pay more than $140 million in retirement benefits to its former chairman, a scandal that led to criminal charges against the Japanese carmaker and rattled the world’s largest auto alliance.

headline.main: Nissan and Carlos Ghosn Settle S.E.C. Charges of Underreporting Compensation
headline.print_headline: Nissan and Ghosn Settle With S.E.C.

docs.abstract: The company that once served Britain’s elite has met an undignified end that would have “appalled” the man who started it, his biographer says.
docs.snippet: The company that once served Britain’s elite has met an undignified end that would have “appalled” the man who started it, his biographer says.
docs.lead_paragraph: The demise of Thomas Cook, Britain’s most venerated travel agency, is shaping up as one of the country’s greatest corporate fiascos.

headline.main: What Killed Thomas Cook, One of the Oldest Names in Travel?

docs.abstract: After more than 50 years and 44 National Magazine Awards, New York finds a home with a digital-media powerhouse.
docs.snippet: After more than 50 years and 44 National Magazine Awards, New York finds a home with a digital-media powerhouse.
docs.lead_paragraph: After more than 50 years of chronicling the highbrow, lowbrow, brilliant and despicable characters of the city whose name it took, New York Magazine has a new owner.

headline.main: Vox Media Acquires New York Magazine, Chronicler of the Highbrow and Lowbrow
headline.print_headline: A New Owner For New York Magazine

byline.original: By Marc Tracy and Edmund Lee
